doc.field: New-York Historical Society collection of albums
New-York Historical Society collection of albums

Photographs of riot scenes in front of the Union Club, Fifth Avenue, and in front of Saint Patrick's Cathedral, when the MacSwiney mourners came out of Saint Patrick's and tore down the British flag from the Union Club, November 26, 1920

Photographs of riot scenes in front of the Union Club, Fifth Avenue, and in front of Saint Patrick's Cathedral, when the MacSwiney mourners came out of Saint Patrick's and tore down the British flag from the Union Club, November 26, 1920

Each photograph labeled "Copyright the Daily News. New York's Picture Newspaper, 1920"; crowds coming out of St. Patrick's, police with the crowd, some with night sticks raised, women being arrested, views of the University Club, including flags, and broken window.
